message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.THEORY

Reasoning: The paper proposes a theory of encodings and expressiveness, which is a topic that falls under the area of theoretical computer science. The paper discusses system description languages and their expressive power, which suggests that it may belong to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Additionally, the paper compares the proposed definition with other definitions found in the literature, which suggests that it may also belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) and Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-categories. The paper also discusses a case study involving the encoding of the synchronous in the asynchronous $\pi$-calculus, which suggests that it may belong to the Formal Languages and Automata Theory (cs.FL) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a definition of encoding and expressiveness, which suggests that it may also belong to the Theory of Computation (cs.THEORY) sub-category.
